metadata.title: CVE-2024-25126 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS-preview 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
Rack is a modular Ruby web server interface. Carefully crafted content typeheaders can cause Rackâ€™s media type parser to take much longer thanexpected, leading to a possible denial of service vulnerability (ReDos 2nddegree polynomial). This vulnerability is patched in 3.0.9.1 and 2.2.8.1.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-25126` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

ruby-rack - 2.1.4-5ubuntu1.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: ruby-rack package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.1.4-5ubuntu1.1').
